riddle: What has hands but can’t clap?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What has one eye but can’t see?
I have wings, I’m able to fly. I’m not a bird, yet I soar high. What am I?
I jump when I walk and sit when I stand. What am I?
I have black and white stripes and look like a horse. What am I?
I have pages but I’m not a magazine. I have a cover but I’m not a bed. What am I?
I am an odd number. Take away one letter, and I become even. What am I?
What has four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon, and three legs in the evening?
answer: A human 👱🏻(Crawls as a baby, walks on two legs as an adult, and uses a cane when old)

riddle: I’m round and red, and I grow on a tree. You can make me into juice. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. Wherever I go, darkness follows me. What am I?
The more you remove from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
